description: An uninhabited island in the Calm Belt northwest of Amazon Lily. Known as a '48 season island' where the climate changes almost weekly, creating extreme environmental conditions. The island is home to over 500 wild beasts that surpass Luffy's initial strength level. A country once existed here but the inhabitants could not survive against the harsh environment. The island features one safe zone - a tree that animals naturally avoid, similar to Daft Green but non-poisonous.

keyEvents.title: Rusukaina Debut
keyEvents.description: Rayleigh brings Luffy to Rusukaina and explains the island's extreme conditions, including its 48 seasons per year and 500 powerful beasts.
keyEvents.significance: Introduction of the location where Luffy will spend two years training to master Haki.

keyEvents.title: Giant Elephant Attack
keyEvents.description: A massive elephant attacks Luffy and Rayleigh, demonstrating the island's dangerous wildlife.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes the challenge level of the island's inhabitants.

keyEvents.title: Rayleigh's Haki Demonstration
keyEvents.description: Rayleigh demonstrates all three types of Haki while fighting the elephant on Rusukaina.
keyEvents.significance: The island serves as the stage for introducing the Haki system to Luffy.

keyEvents.title: Luffy Places Straw Hat in Safe Zone
keyEvents.description: Luffy places his straw hat and Rayleigh's Vivre Card in the island's only safe area before training begins.
keyEvents.significance: Symbolic moment showing Luffy's commitment to training.

keyEvents.title: Training Begins on Rusukaina
keyEvents.description: Luffy officially begins his two-year training regimen on the island with Rayleigh.
keyEvents.significance: Marks the start of the timeskip period.

statusHistory.reason: Uninhabited island used for Luffy's training

description: The ship of the Kuja Pirates, captained by Boa Hancock. The ship is pulled by swimming snakes called Yuda and can navigate the Calm Belt safely.

keyEvents.title: Jinbe Departs
keyEvents.description: Jinbe says farewell to Luffy aboard the Kuja Pirates' ship before Hancock transports Luffy and Rayleigh to Rusukaina.
keyEvents.significance: The location of Jinbe's departure and promise to reunite in two years.
